posts.title: Mock Assessment Centre with IBM
posts.content:
Not sure what to expect at an assessment centre?

Come along to this session to understand what a real life assessment centre will be like at one of the UK’s top graduate employers.

The dedicated team of IBMers will be on hand to give you an insight into the process and what assessors expect. You’ll get to take part in group activities just like during the real thing.

Participating in this session will enable you to:

  • Increase your familiarity with the range of exercises used by employers in assessment centres
  • Identify your own strengths and weaknesses and use feedback to improve your performance to give you the advantage over others

posts.title: Interview Skills Session with BDO
posts.content:
Do you want to gain some valuable interview skills and learn some top tips for success?

Then why not come along and hear from professional individuals from within the business who have first hand experience of the recruitment process?

It will be part discussion and presentation with an element of interactivity in the form of exercises that will help potential applicants to excel in an interview environment.

posts.title: Mock Assessment Centre with BAE Systems
posts.title_plain: Mock Assessment Centre with BAE Systems
posts.content:
Do you want to gain some valuable experience in assessment centre exercises and learn some top tips for success?

Graduate assessment centres are one of the main ways that large employers evaluate prospective employees.

They usually involve a combination of individual and group tasks, designed to test you in a number of scenarios under observation and time constraints.

Some are designed to mirror your job, while others focus more on the organisation’s desired competencies or behavioural characteristics.

BAE Systems are offering you the chance to attend a Mock Assessment Centre to provide the opportunity to practice some assessment centre exercises and provide you with some top tips for success.

posts.title: British Council Employment Presentation
posts.content:
Study, Work and Create overseas with British Council international placements.

Are you a UK student interested in developing your skills and gaining life-changing international experience on a study or work placement? Ranging from 2 weeks to a full year, the British Council has the opportunities for you.

Learn new skills in your chosen sector, gain experience in the workplace or academic institution or inspire pupils as a teaching assistant. With employers highlighting the vital importance of international experience, this will be the perfect addition to your CV!

Come along to our promotional talk to find out more about our international placements including current opportunities to study, work and teach in India or China.

posts.title: Construction Fair
posts.content:
This is a great opportunity for students and graduates looking for industrial placements and/or graduate roles within the construction sector.

Many companies will be in attendance, recruiting for job roles that include Quantity Surveyors, Civil Engineering and Property Development.

Companies will be recruiting for both placement and graduate opportunities.

Attending the event is a great opportunity to:

  • find out information not available on company websites
  • put yourself out there to be head hunted
  • boost your application by stating that you have attended and met an organisation
  • find out about available graduate jobs
  • find out about placement opportunities

posts.title: Local Government Association Employment Presentation
posts.content:
The NGDP is a two-year programme that has been set up to provide local government with the high-calibre managers that communities need by giving committed graduates the training and opportunities to make a positive impact in the sector.

This unique development offer provides you with experience in a dynamic, exciting and socially responsible employer: a launch pad for a successful leadership career in local government. We also recognise you as an individual and will place you right at the centre of your own career development.

Local government is the largest and most diverse employer in England, with around 1.2 million staff in over 400 local authorities and in excess of 500 different occupational areas. Since 2002 over 730 graduates have completed the programme with many now holding influential managerial and policy roles in local government and the wider public sector.

The sector is currently going through a huge programme of change and this is your chance to help redefine how councils will operate in the future for the benefit of local communities. The NGDP will provide you with a rich experience, based around placements that will engage you in work that is core to the council’s priorities within their local communities.

This broad experience will enable you to gain a real and detailed understanding of the many different aspects of local government and the issues relating to delivering services to local communities.

Come to one of the presentations to find out more about the programme, the application process and how you can make a difference!

As numbers are limited, please book your space on one of the two presentations: 12.30pm or 4.00pm.

Click here to add the 12.30pm presentation to your 

Click here to add the 4.00pm presentation to your

posts.title: Army Leadership Session
posts.content:
Southampton Officer Training Corps (SUOTC) is offering a bespoke leadership training package for Portsmouth University (SUOTC belongs to the Sandhurst Group which is a world recognised leadership brand).The package is aimed at building your understanding of leadership to help you be better leaders in the future and build your CV.

The package comprises of two parts:

  • Exploring Leadership (27 Oct 2016).
  • Leadership in Practice, a practical leadership session putting into practice what you have learned (3 Nov 2016).

If you attend both leadership sessions you will receive a certificate which will provide you with evidence for your CV, demonstrating that you have taken part in leadership training and that you have an understanding of the subject.

Exploring leadership will be an interactive session using the Army’s leadership model to examine the subject giving you an understanding of leadership theory.The knowledge and insight you gain from this will enable you to reflect on and develop your own style of leadership.

Leadership in Practice is a series of practical tasks to enable participants put into practice what they have learned in the theory element. The tasks are designed to test leadership, teamwork and organisation.

SUOTC is a unique university club but also part of the Army Reserve training and developing students in leadership. One of the universities which contribute students is Portsmouth.The programme undergraduates follow include military and adventurous training as the vehicle to demonstrate, test and develop individual leadership potential.Click here to add the event to your  ‌‌

posts.title: Effective Applications Presentation with IBM
posts.content:
IBM has been voted Target Graduate Employer of the year for the last three years and the Times IT Graduate Employer of Choice for the last five years. They receive many applications each year and know a thing or two about applications that stand out from the crowd!

Come along to this skills session and gain an insight into what employers really look for in an application and find out how to demonstrate you have the key skills they want. You will gain many hints and tips on how to successfully complete effective application forms and is a session not to be missed!

IBM will also be holding a mock assessment centre in Purple Door on 24 November 2016 at 1pm – book a space to find out more about an IBM assessment centre and gain some experience in group activities.

posts.title: BAE Systems Employment Presentation
posts.content:
BAE Systems are looking to recruit students from any degree disciplines for Industrial Placement and Graduate Roles

BAE Systems serves the needs of customers by delivering a wide range of advanced defence, aerospace, and security solutions that provide a technological and performance edge. We work together with local partners to develop, engineer, manufacture and support the innovations that sustain economies, increase defence sovereignty and safeguard commercial interests.

With some 88,000 employees in six continents, our story is about talented people who are relentlessly committed to creating solutions that protect and strengthen nations, commerce, communities, and people.

This event will provide a great opportunity to find out about the various roles on offer at BAE Systems, their application process, selection criteria and further information on the company not found in graduate literature or on the website.

Have a chat with current staff about what it is like to work for the company and find out about the excellent training and development opportunities offered to graduates.

This is a drop in event and you can turn up from 5.30pm.

Please note BAE Systems are also holding a mock assessment centre on 10th November 2016 to provide an insight into what to expect at a graduate assessment centre.
